docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
Provides an abstract TemplateView pattern implementation.
docblock.long-description: We use an abstract so that the extended "real" Template class does not have access to the private support properties herein.

docblock.description: View "finder" (to find views in a path stack).
Data assigned to the template.

A ServiceLocator implementation for loading and retaining helper objects.
A registry to retain helper objects.
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of key-value pairs where the key is the helper name (doubles as a method name) and the value is the helper object. The value may also be a closure that returns a helper object. Note that is has to be a closure, not just any callable, because the helper object itself might be callable.

docblock.description: Sets a helper into the registry by name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The helper name; this doubles as a method name when called from a template.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The helper specification, typically a closure that builds and returns a helper object.

docblock.description: Gets a helper from the registry by name.
This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
Provides a concrete Template View pattern implementation; it does not have access to the private support properties of the parent abstract.
Fetches the output from a template.
Fetches the output from a partial.
docblock.long-description: The partial will be executed in isolation from the rest of the template, which means $this refers to the partial data, not the original template data. However, helper objects are shared between the original template and the partial.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Data to use for the partial.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
Finds files in user-defined path hierarchies.
The stack of paths.
A cache of found files, so we do not need to search the path stack for a particular file more than once.
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The default path stack for this TemplateFinder.

docblock.description: Gets a copy of the current path stack.
Adds one path to the top of the path stack.
docblock.long-description: {{code: php $template_finder->prepend('/path/1'); $template_finder->prepend('/path/2'); $template_finder->prepend('/path/3'); // $template_finder->getPaths() reveals that the directory search order will be // '/path/3/', '/path/2/', '/path/1/'. }}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directories to add to the paths.

docblock.description: Adds one path to the end of the path stack.
docblock.long-description: {{code: php $template_finder->append('/path/1'); $template_finder->append('/path/2'); $template_finder->append('/path/3'); // $template_finder->getPaths() reveals that the directory search order will be // '/path/1/', '/path/2/', '/path/3/'. }}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directories to add to the paths.

docblock.description: Sets the paths directly.
docblock.long-description: {{code: php $template_finder->setPaths([ '/path/1', '/path/2', '/path/3', ]); // $template_finder->getPaths() reveals that the search order will be // '/path/1', '/path/2', '/path/3'. }}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The directories to add to the paths.

docblock.description: Finds a file in the paths.
docblock.long-description:
{{code: php $template_finder->append('/path/1'); $template_finder->append('/path/2'); $template_finder->append('/path/3');

$file = $template_finder->find('file.php');
// $file is now the first instance of 'file.php' found from the
// assigned paths, looking first for '/path/3/file.php', then for
// '/path/2/file.php', then finally for '/path/1/file.php'.

}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: The file to find using the assigned paths.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The absolute path to the file, or false if not found using the paths.

docblock.description: Checks to see if a file exists at a particular location.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The absolute path to the file, or false if not found.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
Provides a TwoStepView pattern implementation; this allows for an inner ("core") view and and outer ("layout") view as commonly used by web apps.
An array of Accept headers, in the format ['type' => weight].
The shared data for inner and outer views.
The .format to render.
A FormatTypes object to map .format values to Content-Type values.
The paths to search when finding an inner view template.
The inner view to use.
docblock.long-description:
This may be one of three types:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute. It should take no parameters.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

docblock.description: The name of the variable in the outer view template that should be replaced with the output of the inner view template.
The Template object to be used when rendering the inner view and outer view.
The paths to search when finding the outer view template.
The inner view to use.
docblock.long-description:
This may be one of three types:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute; it should be a single parameter, $inner, which is the content of the inner view.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

docblock.description: Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The Template object to be used when rendering the inner view and outer view.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An object that maps formats to types.

docblock.description: Set the Accept values for negotiating formats.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array where each key is a content-type and each value is a corresponding weight.

docblock.description: Returns the Accept values for negotiating formats.
Sets the .format to pick when the inner/outer views provide multiple formats.
Returns the .format to pick when the inner/outer views provide multiple formats.
Returns the Content-Type for the current .format, if any.
Sets the shared data for inner and outer views.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data for the inner and outer views.

docblock.description: Returns the shared data for inner and outer views.
Sets inner view specification.
docblock.long-description:
The specification may be:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A closure to execute; it should take no parameters.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

docblock.description: Returns the inner view specification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Only return the specification for this .format; if null, return all formats.

docblock.description: Sets the paths to search when finding the inner view template.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The paths to search when finding the inner view template.

docblock.description: Appends a path to search when finding the inner view template.
Returns the paths to search when finding the inner view template.
Sets the outer view specification.
docblock.long-description:
The specification may be:

  • (string) A template file name.

  • (callable) A callable to execute; it should take one parameter, $inner, which is the content of the inner view.

  • (array) An array where each element key is a .format name, and the corresponding element value is a string or a callable. This type is most useful when allowing for multiple views using the same data.

docblock.description: Returns the outer view specification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Only return the specification for this .format; if null, return all formats.

docblock.description: Sets the paths to search when finding the outer view template.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The paths to search when finding the outer view template.

docblock.description: Appends a path to search when finding the outer view template.
Returns the paths to search when finding the outer view template.
Sets the name of the variable in the outer view template that should be replaced with the output of the inner view template.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The variable name in the outer view template.

docblock.description: Returns the name of the variable in the outer view template that should be replaced with the output of the inner view template.
Renders the inner view and outer view and returns the resulting output, negotiating a format from the accept header values.
Renders a view (inner or outer).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Look through these paths for view templates.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If $view is null, use this as the default rendering result.

docblock.description: Gets the view for a particular format.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The inner or outer view specification.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The matching view for the format.
